蘙字的基本解释

蘙
yì
古书上说的一种草。
古同“翳”，遮蔽：“先是斯境，蘙于榛薄。”

蘙字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yì］
［《廣韻》於計切，去霽，影。］
(1)草茂貌。
(2)遮蔽。

蘙字的康熙字典解释

【申集上】【艸字部】　蘙； 康熙笔画：23； 页码：页1069第12
【唐韻】【正韻】?於計切，音翳。蘙薈，草盛貌。　又【集韻】草名。

蘙字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
蘙字的起名意思

古书上说的一种草。

Pan
Basic explanation of words
Pan
yì
A kind of grass said in ancient books.
Gu Tong's "翳", covering: "First of all, it's Sijing, but it's Yu Zhenbo."
Pan
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［yì］
["Guangyun" Yu Jiqie, go to Ji, shadow. ]
(1) Grassy appearance.
(2) Shading.
Pan
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Shen Ji 1] [Department of Zong Zi] 　蘙; Kangxi strokes: 23; Page number: page 1069 to 12
[Tang Yun] [Zheng Yun]? Yu Jiqie, Yinyi. Huihui, the grass is full of appearance.　[Jiyun] Cursive name.
